page.title: 12Animal Life Around Nantwich.
page.content: The landscape of the area when viewed from the air resembles a green patchwork quilt, with freisian cows contentedly grazing in almost every field or shading themselves under the oaks that abound in the hedges and fields.It is in this environment that man holds the delicate balance of the ecosystems but the wide variety of animal and plant life to be found is evidence that man and nature do exist side by side.Of the larger mammals, the{fox and badger}both breed in the area and can frequently be seen crossing the roads.Of the smaller mammals,{rabbit and hare}are common along with the{hedgehog.}Breeding colonies of{grey squirrels}are to be found.{Stoat and weasel}hunt the pasture whilst{mink}tracks have been seen along the river bank.The rarer {harvest mouse}has also been observed.
